content.description: This route heads up to the roof and then straight out to the lip. Enjoy the jug haul in the middle and then set up for the thin and dynamic crux move to finish.
content.protection: Fixed draws, quickdraws, fixed biner anchors.
content.location: This is the 2nd route from the left, the first route with fixed draws. Starts on a few steep slab moves and then goes directly out the roof.

content.description: This is a linkup of all the crux sections for smoking joe, club foot, and sick boy. Start with the opening moves for Sick boy, head left to the last fixed draw on clubfoot, and then to a very thin move left again to do the last moves of Smokin Joe Tahoe. Finish at the chains for smokin Joe. Might just be a 13a, or very stiff at the grade.
content.protection: quickdraws, fixed draws, fixed biner anchors
content.location: starts on Sick boy, the route second from the right. Follow the draws always trending left.

content.description: Route heads up a short steep face to some thin moves to a rail, then hard deadpoint to a sloping shelf. After this, head up some more steep terrain and finish on the last few moves of club foot. Stiff and thin crux.
content.protection: quickdraws, fixed draws, fixed biner anchors
content.location: Route is second from the right, fixed draws, look for an gap between the holds where the deadpoint is.

content.description: Route is on the far right of the cave, rumored to be somewhere in the 13's. Not an open project, notice the red tag. Hopefully it get sent soon.

This route is the least climbed route in the cave, probably due to the lack of fixed draws. the farthest route on the left, heads up the short face and then out to the lip with some of the roof completely horizontal.
content.location: route is the farthest left in the cave, no fixed draws

content.description: This climb starts up an easy left leaning lieback to a good rest just before the roof becomes almost horizontal. The line traverses right on the shelf system to a crux at the very end. Great fun on dynamic and very pumpy climbing.
content.protection: Quickdraws, fixed draws through the roof, fixed biner anchors.
content.location: This is the route 3rd from the left in the cave, look for the draws that traverse up and to the right.
